SVTFactory

Class SVTConstants

  • java.lang.Object
    • SVTFactory.SVTConstants

  • public class SVTConstants
extends java.lang.Object

    Geometry for the SVT

    length unit: mm (3D Primitives), cm (Geant4Basic volume positions)
    angle unit: deg
    Conventions:
    • svt = four concentric regions / superlayers
    • region / superlayer = ring of a variable number of sectors
    • sector = pair of sensor modules and backing structure, connected and stabilised by copper and peek supports
    • module = triplet of sensors
    • sensor = silicon with etched strips in active region
    • layer = plane of sensitive strips, spanning active regions of module
    • strip = sensitive line

    • Method Detail

      • connect

        public static DatabaseConstantProvider connect(boolean loadAlignmentTable)
        Connects a DatabaseConstantProvider to CCDB with run 10 and default variation. Will be moved to DatabaseLoader at a later date.
        Parameters:
        loadAlignmentTable - a switch to load the tables containing alignment shifts for sectors and layers
        Returns:
        ConstantProvider a ConstantProvider that has loaded the necessary tables

      • getCcdbPath

        public static java.lang.String getCcdbPath()
        Returns the path to the database directory that contains the core parameters and constants for the SVT.
        To use with DatabaseConstantProvider:
        • Access tables with getCcdbPath() +"table".
        • Access constants with getCcdbPath() +"table/constant".
        Returns:
        String a path to a directory in CCDB of the format "/geometry/detector/"

      • setCcdbPath

        public static void setCcdbPath(java.lang.String aPath)
        Sets the path to the database directory that contains the core parameters and constants for the SVT.
        Parameters:
        aPath - a path to a directory in CCDB of the format "/geometry/detector/"

      • load

        public static void load(org.jlab.geom.base.ConstantProvider cp)
        Reads all the necessary constants from CCDB into static variables. Please use a DatabaseConstantProvider to access CCDB and load the following tables: svt, region, support, fiducial, material, alignment.
        Parameters:
        cp - a ConstantProvider that has loaded the necessary tables

      • loadAlignmentShifts

        public static void loadAlignmentShifts(org.jlab.geom.base.ConstantProvider cp)
        Reads alignment data from CCDB.
        Parameters:
        cp - a DatabaseConstantProvider that has loaded the "alignment" table

      • loadSectorAlignmentShifts

        public static void loadSectorAlignmentShifts(java.lang.String aFilename)
        Reads alignment data for sectors from the given file. The translation and axis-angle rotation data should be of the form { tx, ty, tz, rx, ry, rz, ra }.
        Parameters:
        aFilename - a filename

      • showSectorShiftData

        public static void showSectorShiftData()
        Prints alignment shift data for sectors to screen.

      • convertRegionSectorFiducial2Index

        public static int convertRegionSectorFiducial2Index(int aRegion,
                                                    int aSector,
                                                    int aFiducial)
                                             throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Converts RSF indices to linear index. Useful for writing data files.
        Parameters:
        aRegion - an index starting from 0
        aSector - an index starting from 0
        aFiducial - an index starting from 0
        Returns:
        int an index used for fiducial survey data
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - indices out of bounds

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        int[] an array containing RSF indices
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - index out of bounds

      • getLabFrame

        public static org.jlab.geom.prim.Transformation3D getLabFrame(int aRegion,
                                                              int aSector,
                                                              double aRadius,
                                                              double aZ)
                                                       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Returns a transformation from the local frame to the lab frame, for the given parameters of a sector module.
        Parameters:
        aRegion - an index starting from 0
        aSector - an index starting from 0
        aRadius - transverse distance from beamline
        aZ - longitudinal distance along beamline
        Returns:
        Transformation3D a sequence of transformations
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - indices out of bounds

      • getStripFrame

        public static org.jlab.geom.prim.Transformation3D getStripFrame(boolean aFlip)
        Returns a transformation for the strip frame to the local frame.
        Parameters:
        aFlip - whether the transformation should append a rotation of 180 deg about the z axis
        Returns:
        Transformation3D a sequence of transformations

      • getDataAlignmentSectorShift

        public static double[][] getDataAlignmentSectorShift()
        Returns the alignment data.
        Returns:
        double[][] an array of translations and axis-angle rotations of the form { tx, ty, tz, rx, ry, rz, ra }
